message:
is it illegal in Egypt to run a shodan-like service ? 

let me rephrase that  : is it illegal to knock on every door in Egypt and record whatever response you get  ?

data.message: I don't believe there is a law against it. But if you knock on the wrong door, it is not the law that will be responding either :D
ya  , i thought the same , depending on the door you could be treated under a whole different  law category  :)

if u knock my door and find camera filming me. I wud crash this camera. and when is come to laws u who violent me in my property. also fliming even in public streets is illegal to the laws you must have permit from nearby police station to be able to take pictures or recording any videos.
I believe the Knockig & Recording part is figure speech, try to research what shodan is :D

and p.s I really dont know wht is shodan. so my answer was concern the recording if is photo or video material. as even Google when they came to egypt they had permission to do the street view from gov

Ashraf Kaabi  it was a figure of speech ya but let me follow with you  , if i recorded your home after you open the door that's is an invasion of privacy right  ?? how about if i just took a picture of your door form the outside ? and how about if i recorded your home doorbell ? these are thing intended to be publicly displayed

You cannot actually record the inside of my house even if I willingly open the door unless you have clear permission to do so. The exterior of the house is public info of course, but being legal does not always mean nice ;)
ya ,but nice is not part of the game now is it  :)

هى المشكلة لو حد شك فيك انك اخوان ولا عمييل و الحاجات دى مش هيحصلك كويس :) محتاج تختار كويس مين اللى هتخبط عليهم :D
غير كدة مفييش حد هيطبق قانون فى مصر حتى لو فيه القانون ده :D

Assuming door visibility is public (which will be up to interpretation of not-so-educated officials), public recording requires a permit anyway.

Plus in these mad times, wrong interpretation could possibly end your life (literally or in long prison stay equal to death), for accusation of being a spy.

Mohamed Meligy  so if  took a print screen of a government website i would be considered breaking the law :D  , but i see people and newspapers doing this every day and even publishing it 

but seriously , i would really like to imagine how a lawyer would be defending this in a court here in Egypt  :)
No, I'm talking about public roads, completely different story.
it should be the same principle  , it is funny that different rules apply to the  same things in our country  , if you want to try something new you just have to assume and take the risk

Mohamed Abdel Aty News papers got permit for photographing or recording any news footage. at 2007 I was doing some photography shots in maadi, road 9, for a project with small digital camera. and police officer come and ask me where is your permission and I told him I don't know why I need permission im just taking photos he force me to stop taking photos or he gonna take action on that. is a mad world

http://tinyurl.com/lptgnpf

They were shooting commercial at some malls and I guess because they didn't bribe the guys around they got into fight. this is a professional director making famous tv ads
